date.headline: Phase 0. Taking stock: reviewing existing modeling capabilities
date.text:
1. gathering information from research groups about different simulation models currently used
  2. providing short and accessible model descriptions of available simulation tools for energy-related socio-economic research in Switzerland
  3. providing a synopsis of key model features and categorization of models in light of existing modeling paradigms
  4. providing meta-information about socio-economic data used in different simulation models

date.headline: Phase 1: Sharing knowledge; creating a resource and virtual knowledge platform
date.text:
The SimLab website is the main vehicle to:
  1. share knowledge of existing simulation-related capabilities;
  2. provide continuously updated information as models evolve & new tools are being added
  3. provide access to both simulation models and data

date.headline: Phase 2. Towards a framework for integrated assessment: integration of insights and model interfaces
date.text:
1. explore if and how existing simulation models be interfaced to create improved simulation tools for socio-economic analysis of the Swiss energy transition,
  2. identify both value-added of model linkages and scope for project-based collaboration among research groups which use alternative simulation models
  3. integrate insights from other work streams
